DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Disease Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the personal medical history of concomitant diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the personal medical history of concomitant diseases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual.  In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Significant Medical History,
ReferenceDocuments.description: Significant Medical History, Concomitant Diseases and/or Relevant Medical Conditions

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any other serious concomitant medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the safety of the patient or compromise the patient's ability to participate in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any other serious concomitant medical condition that, in the opinion of the investigator, would compromise the safety of the patient, compromise the patient's ability to participate in the study, or cause a delay in the initiation of therapy (surgery or chemotherapy) longer than 4 weeks following randomization?

ReferenceDocuments.name: 9177 Excusion Criteria Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a serious concomitant medical illness that would jeopardize the patient's ability to receive the regimen with reasonable safety

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have current life-threatening illness, medical condition, or organ system dysfunction which in the investigator's opinion could compromise the patient's safety or put the study at risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concomitant medical illness such as uncontrolled infection, uncontrolled angina or serious peripheral neuropathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the Subject had any clinically significant medical history or ongoing conditions not related to the cervical cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NCIP Text-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient developed any other malignancies or other serious illness since the last report

DataElement.origin: NCIC CRF:National Cancer Institute of Canada Case Report Form
DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
